Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it‚Äôs AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist (Generative AI Focus)

Permanent, Fully remote within Portugal




A permanent opportunity is open for a Senior Data Scientist to join a forward-thinking AI team, leading the development and deployment of machine learning models ‚Äî with a growing emphasis on Generative AI.




Key Responsibilities

Translate business and product requirements into scalable machine learning solutions
Identify high-impact opportunities for applying Generative AI, from ideation to production
Perform in-depth data analysis (EDA), feature engineering, and model evaluation
Design and implement machine learning models, including both traditional ML and deep learning approaches
Run structured experiments to compare model architectures and optimize performance
Deploy models into production environments and maintain continuous improvement loops




Required Qualifications

Strong theoretical understanding and practical experience with machine learning algorithms
Proven track record of deploying machine learning models into production
Hands-on experience with Generative AI frameworks (e.g., LLMs, transformers, diffusion models)
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with object-oriented programming
Solid MLOps experience, including model monitoring and CI/CD pipelines




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with GenAI application development (e.g., conversational agents, content generation, personalization)
Exposure to Big Data tools such as Spark or PySpark
Familiarity with cloud platforms, ideally Azure and Databricks
Industry experience in domains such as fraud detection, recommendation systems, CRM, or sports tech




sam.house@signify-technology.com

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Python Developer

Seniority: Mid-s√©nior




The amazing you, will have:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a python Developer;
Solid knowledge of Python, FastAPI, Sphinx, Helm, GitHub, Azure cloud resources, Docker
Fluency in the English language (mandatory) and portuguese;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto or Lisbon (Portugal);










Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!


We are looking for an Amazing: Python Developer

Seniority: Mid-s√©nior


The amazing you, will have:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
  • Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a python Developer;
  • Solid knowledge of Python, FastAPI, Sphinx, Helm, GitHub, Azure cloud resources, Docker
  • Fluency in the English language (mandatory) and portuguese;
  • Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto or Lisbon (Portugal);




Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Title: Phyton Developer
Description:
About Welvaart

On a daily basis, we assume commitments and present solutions to our stakeholders in order to create a structure of human values, based on professionalism, honesty and rigor.

With a management based on Human Centered Design, we take care of our professionals with consistent career plans, but flexible with their needs and expectations of evolution. Our management team guarantees an empathetic and present leadership that will provide superior technological engagement and delivery to our clients' projects and products.

Project

The Developer's mission is to contribute to the functional and application related consistency of the IT solution and ensure the service continuity and continuous development. The Developer must perform activities within the framework of projects and/or application maintenance and development, seeking its continuous development and assuring its compliance with Quality and Security guidelines and best practices.

Role


Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the products solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.


We are looking for


Experience in Phyton, Flask/ Fast API
Knoweledge of SQL
Experience with JavaScript and Angular


What you can discover with us?


Be part of a tech start-up
Different scopes of project in different sectors
Structure of fairness and equity salary (Consultant Profile)
Training & Certification
Career Path management
More than 30 Partnerships
Welvaart Ambassador Program


UNLEASH THE POWER OF YOUR CAREER

Title: Data Scientist - SAS & Python Specialist
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary¬†




Keyrus is seeking a Data Scientist -¬†SAS/Python Specialist to join a critical data transformation initiative, supporting the migration of legacy SAS processes to a modern, scalable Python-based platform. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimising data pipelines, ensuring performance, scalability, and alignment with business requirements.

Location: Portugal (Might require On-site attendance).
Start date: September¬†




Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and contribute to the migration of data workflows from SAS to Python, ensuring functionality and performance are maintained or improved
Design and implement robust Python solutions tailored to business and technical needs
Optimise existing data pipelines and develop new algorithms for improved efficiency and scalability
Collaborate closely with data engineers, analysts, and project stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver production-ready solutions
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues in Python processes
Document code, migration strategies, and technical solutions to support knowledge sharing and long-term maintainability




Requirements for the role¬†


5+ years of experience with Python, preferably in senior or lead roles
Strong background in PySpark or Scala for distributed data processing tasks
Solid knowledge of SQL, data structures, and algorithm optimisation techniques
Hands-on experience with¬†SAS, especially SAS Data Integration Studio
Proven experience mentoring or guiding junior team members
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus
Nice to have:¬†Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL best practices
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese¬†or European¬†citizen or have a work permit for Portugal

¬†

What we offer at Keyrus Portugal:

Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?


Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.¬†

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.¬†

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.¬†

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

¬†

Title: MLOPS Engineer
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to perform duties as a MLOPS Engineer for a national project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Design, develop, and implement MLOps pipelines for the continuous deployment and integration of machine learning models
Provide support and guidance to other team members on MLOps practices
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand model requirements and optimize deployment processes
Continuously monitor and maintain models in production, ensuring optimal performance, accuracy and reliability
Optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability, efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to model deployment and performance
Ensure compliance with security and data privacy standards in all MLOps activities
Keep up-to-date with the latest MLOps tools, technologies and trends


üí° What We're Looking For


5-8 years of experience in MLOps or a related field
Ensure compliance with security and data privacy standards in all MLOps activities
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with hands-on experience in machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, automation tools and version control systems like Git
Ensuring the security and reliability of Datascience environments (vulnerabilities, obsolescence...)
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud and their respective machine learning services
Knowledge of GPU usage and management, including: Configure and optimize GPU instances on cloud platforms; Manage GPU drivers and libraries (e.g., CUDA, Nvidia)
Fluency in English


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject ‚ÄúMLOPSE/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Job Title: Quality Assurance Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_24

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Salary: The range is between ‚Ç¨1,751.27 and ‚Ç¨1,834.93, depending on the candidate's professional experience (1 year or more).

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is seeking a talented Quality Assurance Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Connected Things (Cyber-physical systems) Group, namely in Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs. It is expected that the candidate will contribute to the business area of Digital Health.

Your Role

  • Document and maintain software requirements;
  • Document, execute and maintain test cases based on requirements;
  • Develop and maintain UI tests;
  • Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines.

Your Profile

  • Mandatory Requirements:

> Academic Qualifications: Master's degree or equivalent academic qualification in Informatics, Bioengineering, and Computing Engineering or similar;

> Professional Experience: Preferably 1 year of professional experience in the field.

  • Technical Skills:

> Candidates should have experience in software engineering and testing. Experience in developing automated tests for mobile or web applications is highly regarded. The candidate will work in close contact with software development, so experience within this field will be highly valued.

  • Other Skills:

> Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);

> Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Experience with test case management tools, such as TestRail or similar;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins or similar;
  • Candidates experienced in automating tests of Flutter and/or Java (Spring Boot) applications using mocking tools such as Mockito or similar is highly valued;
  • Experience with Quality Management System maintenance or auditing, according to standards such as ISO 13485:2016 or ISO 9001:2015, is valued.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and hybrid work opportunities, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are open from the 5th to the 20th of August 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working October 1st, 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:

  • Curriculum Vitae ‚Äì mandatory;
  • Motivation Letter ‚Äì optional;
  • Recommendation Letters ‚Äì optional.

Selection Process

Admitted candidates will be subject to a curricular evaluation. Based on the results, the top-ranked candidates will be invited for an interview. All applicants will be notified of the results of the call via the email address provided in their application.

After notification, all candidates have 10 days to comment.

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • ATE ‚Äì Alian√ßa para a Transi√ß√£o Energ√©tica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 56 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • ConnectedHealth ‚Äì Smart and End-to-end Healthcare Management Platform, with Notice No. 26/SI/2016 and Project Reference No. POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046858;
  • HfPT ‚Äì Health from Portugal, with Notice No. 02/C05-i01/2022 and Project Reference No. 41 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • SmILE ‚Äì Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, with Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101136376 Horizon Europe Framework Programme.

Title: AI Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

We're expanding our global AI Product Group and seeking skilled software engineers to build a service that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) for document data extraction and GenAI-enabled automation. As part of our cross-functional team, you'll focus on developing robust, scalable software architecture while applying your engineering expertise to create innovative AI-powered solutions.

How you create impact


Design and develop scalable, maintainable software components for our document processing and automation platform.
Build reliable APIs and services that integrate with LLMs from Anthropic, Google, and OpenAI.
Implement efficient services within our Kubernetes environment.
Collaborate with product managers and AI specialists to translate requirements into technical solutions.
Write clean, high-quality code with appropriate test coverage.
Contribute to architectural decisions and best practices for the global team.
Participate in code reviews and technical documentation.


What we would like you to bring


3+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on Python.
Proficient in software design principles and modern development best practices.
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining services in cloud environments (preferably AWS).
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience designing and integrating APIs, including REST and GraphQL.
Understanding of distributed systems and scalable architecture patterns.
Exposure to CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and observability tools.
Bonus: Interest or background in data pipelines, document systems, or AI/ML technologies.


What's in it for you

You will have a direct influence on the future of logistics and IT. Your colleagues are experts who shape the IT industry in Portugal and worldwide. We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you flexible working hours and mobile working arrangements. We value teamwork, continuous learning, and diversity. Kuehne+Nagel offers you a custom-made career ‚Äì through individual planning and supervisors who support and advise you in every way. You get supported by many work-life balance offerings and supplementary health insurance.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Machine Learning Model Evaluation Engineer (Computer Vision)
Description:
Description

We are scaling our AI team with mission-driven individuals eager to shape the future of mobility. As a Machine Learning Model Evaluation Engineer (Computer Vision), you‚Äôll collaborate closely with our research team to design, build, and optimize data infrastructure and annotation workflows. You will be the focal point between the team and the annotation team, ensuring high-quality labeled data and efficient processes. Additionally, you will help optimize our algorithms, analyze performance metrics, and define optimal operating points to enhance model effectiveness. Your work will directly contribute to pushing the boundaries of Vision AI and advancing our cutting-edge projects.

Responsibilities


Model Evaluation Work closely with the research team to evaluate model performance and define optimal operating points using precision, recall, and other ML evaluation metrics.
Annotation Management Be the focal point for annotation processes to ensure high-quality labeled data and streamlined workflows.
Database Management Manage and maintain internal research databases for data-driven decision-making.
Cloud Infrastructure Develop, maintain, and optimize cloud-based data infrastructure (AWS, GCP).
Benchmarking Framework Build and maintain a benchmarking framework for continuous algorithm performance evaluation, including human-in-the-loop pipelines.
Dataset Curation Curate training and testing datasets by querying databases and annotations, and by running data quality and auto-labelling tools.
Model Execution Run algorithms and deep-learning models at scale.


Requirements

Technical skills & qualifications


BA in computer science or other exact science/engineering
3-5 years of experience
Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and model evaluation techniques, and Computer Vision.
Experience with database management (SQL, NoSQL) and large-scale data processing.
Familiarity with data annotation processes and experience managing labeling teams.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams.
Experience working with cloud-based data infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), including provisioning machines for development and multi-GPU training.
Familiarity with data engineering and analytics tools such as Databricks, Spark, and other cloud-based platforms.


People skills & traits


Highly organized and methodical, with a strong eye for detail.
Ability to manage complex processes efficiently while ensuring data integrity.
Creative and innovative problem-solving skills with a passion for cutting-edge technologies and product delivery.
Strong team player and self-learner with excellent communication skills.
A ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù mindset in a fast-paced environment.


What We Offer


The chance to have a meaningful and positive impact on roads and cities‚Äô safety
Flexibility - in schedule, work location, benefits
Competitive compensation
A fast-paced work environment full of kind, smart, and highly driven people
Great professional and personal growth opportunities
Regular team-building events and well-being initiatives/facilities


Who We Are

Nexar turns cars into vision sensors to understand the world. Its platform powers vision-connected services and apps at scale, making new vision-based applications for better driving, powered by a crowd-sourced vision feed. Using anonymous, aggregated data captured from this network, Nexar has developed a portfolio of vision-based data services for the autonomous vehicle industry and public and private sector partners to make roadways safer and more efficient.

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world ‚Äî more information at https://www.nexar-ai.com/.

Nexar is a Vision AI company that is organizing the physical world as digital information. We are a global, connected, and intelligent network of mobile cameras on the road that uses data to deliver valuable insights and build transformative products in vehicle autonomy and safety.

Our goal is to be the best car camera service in the world, with a vast network of smart, connected cameras across the planet. We are unlocking the power of connected driving to protect our users and build a lasting business, and this is where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world.

Title: Python Fullstack Developer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Python Fullstack Developer for a hybrid project based in Porto (2x/Week).


Requirements:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • 3+ years of Full-Stack development experience, end-to-end web application delivery;
  • Professional experience with Python Web Frameworks (Django, Flask, FastAPI).
  • Professional experience developing and maintaining data-centered APIs;
  • Work experience with Front-End frameworks (React, Angular);
  • Strong knowledge on Web UI and UX, with strong fundamentals (HTML, CSS, JS);
  • Strong knowledge on implementing authentication and directory services (SSO, LDAP);
  • Experience implementing RBAC models and User Management systems;
  • Knowledge on data analysis and data handling are a plus;
  • Knowledge on Plotly Dash is a plus;
  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop, maintain and support modern, reactive and responsive Web Applications;
  • Develop, maintain and support custom APIs;
  • Develop and optimize solid backend solutions for both Web Applications and APIs, handling sometimes big volumes of data;
  • Integrate our interfaces with SSO systems;
  • Communicate with stakeholders and build the target Use Experience for our Web Applications; Communicate with stakeholders and achieve the desired outcome for our APIs
  • Develop, maintain and support RBAC and User Management models;
  • Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs;
  • Ensure that the target architecture meets business requirements;
  • Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference CN/FSP.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
The Tribe




"Prozis is a powerhouse product developing company. Every day we make new products. That is only possible because we developed our own proprietary technology that ensures that we bring you high quality, beautiful and fair priced products. We endure in our philosophy of a 4.0 vertical process, manufacturing in our own facilities or with the help of our super partners. We do everything: idea, concept, design, manufacturing, quality control, marketing, sales, logistics, printing, distribution, client support, software development, photo, video, 3D and philosophy. We deliver wherever you are, whenever you want. We don‚Äôt compromise. We breathe technology, drink design and feed on our will to exceed ourselves making the best products in the world. This all starts in 2007 with a crazy guy in a garage that thinks he can change the world for the better. Right now, we are hundreds, going to thousands of crazy but focused people. Will is a skill. There is a lot of people that want to buy us out. We don‚Äôt have a F****** price tag. It‚Äôs not about the money. It‚Äôs about our mission. Trust us. We will feed your body and mind with everything you need to exceed yourself."

- miguel milh√£o




The Team




You probably don't know, but we have a secret and incredible team that develops our electronic projects and takes on impressive and mind-blowing challenges. It might be hard to believe they are hidden in plain sight, but trust us when we say they make magic happen.

Now, we are looking for a Computer Vision Engineer to join this mission and master the art of interpreting the world through images. If you can create prototypes and test innovative concepts in artificial intelligence and computer vision and data processing to solve complex problems‚Äîthen you are the one!




The Job




As a Computer Vision Engineer, you will:




Create prototypes and test innovative concepts in the field of artificial intelligence and computer vision.
Develop neural networks and implement advanced deep learning techniques.
Create algorithms to interpret the world with images;
Analyze and combine expertise in statistics, machine learning and data processing to solve complex problems;
Work with point cloud processing and 3D imaging.




Are you ready for this? Then you're the person we're looking for!




You




We're looking for someone with a degree in Eletronics Engineering (or a related field) and have hands-on experience in similar projects. You need to have programming experience, particularly in C++ and Python, and knowledge of object-oriented development. You should be comfortable working with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch or OpenCV, as well as using libraries such as NumPy and Pandas.




Your Superpowers:




Strong familiarity with computer vision techniques and data processing.
Experience in developing algorithms for tasks like object detection;
Knowledge of deep learning model applications;
Expertise in processing point clouds and 3D images;
Autonomy;
Ability to work under great pressure;
Creative problem-solving skills to find solutions when others don't work;




If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation and excellence.




Btw, Prozis is not for everyone.




Nos termos da Pol√≠tica de Recrutamento do grupo PROZIS, a pessoa portadora de defici√™ncia, nos termos da Lei n.¬∫ 38/2004, de 18/08, cuja candidatura n√£o tenha sido admitida ou respondida no prazo de 30 dias, tem a faculdade de pedir a fundamenta√ß√£o da decis√£o e a sua reavalia√ß√£o atrav√©s de pedido apresentado no canal de den√∫ncias constante de www.prozis.com, na categoria "direitos e protec√ß√£o dos indiv√≠duos".

Btw, Prozis is not for everyone.


Nos termos da Pol√≠tica de Recrutamento do grupo PROZIS, a pessoa portadora de defici√™ncia, nos termos da Lei n.¬∫ 38/2004, de 18/08, cuja candidatura n√£o tenha sido admitida ou respondida no prazo de 30 dias, tem a faculdade de pedir a fundamenta√ß√£o da decis√£o e a sua reavalia√ß√£o atrav√©s de pedido apresentado no canal de den√∫ncias constante de www.prozis.com, na categoria "direitos e protec√ß√£o dos indiv√≠duos".

Title: Junior Software Developer
HTML:
We are looking for a Junior Software Scientist to join our team. The primary focus of this role is to develop and maintain web scraping pipelines in Go (Golang), while also contributing to general backend development efforts. You will work on extracting data from diverse web sources, ensuring robustness, performance, and scalability. This is an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about data acquisition, backend systems, and solving real-world problems through automation and clean code.


What you will be doing:


  • Design, implement, and maintain web scraping pipelines using Go;
  • Ensure reliability and scalability of scraping systems and manage scraping infrastructure;
  • Develop and support backend systems that integrate with other services (APIs, databases, etc.);
  • Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data needs and deliver structured datasets;
  • Monitor, debug, and optimize scraping jobs and backend workflows for performance and efficiency;
  • Handle challenges such as anti-bot systems, rate limits, and data deduplication;
  • Participate in system architecture discussions and help shape technical direction;
  • Write clean, well-documented, and tested code that adheres to industry best practices.


Requirements:


  • Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field;
  • Past programming contact with Go (Golang) or williness to learn;
  • Understanding of HTTP, HTML parsing, and web protocols;
  • Familiarity with concurrent programming, APIs, and RESTful services;
  • Past contact with databases (SQL and/or NoSQL);
  • Basic knowledge of containerization (e.g., Docker) and CI/CD tools is a plus;
  • Critical thinker with an appetite for automation and process improvement;
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment;
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Perks:


  • Flexible Hybrid Work System;
  • 15th‚ÄØMonth Bonus Salary Policy;
  • 4 extra vacation days;
  • Participation in International Projects;
  • Company-Paid Certifications;
  • Training, career progression and support;
  • Team Building Activities,
  • Innovative & Young Culture.


Location:


We‚Äôre based in Porto, Portugal. Although there is the possibility of remote working, we are only considering people located in Portugal.

Title: Internships PT
Description:
It might be useful to read these before you apply: handbook, self-organization, feedback and take a look at our website mindera.com

Every year we open a few internships.

We avoid "herds", meaning we are looking for a few unicorn students.

Why just a few?

We want to pair you with the best and brightest from each tech stack that have the time to support your growth.

Why?

Our measure of internship success is if you at the end of our internship have grown drastically and we deeply want you to remain with us (while all other companies around us all want you too), but we hope you have enjoyed this journey enough to remain with us!

What can you find here?


We will treat you like an Adult (check the self-organization link above) but basically we want people that like to be autonomous and don't need adult (cof manager cof) supervison to tell them what they need to do all the time
Although this might sound weird... don't take autonomy for no team work. We are all about team work. Hope you are a team player, since this we what allow us to create magic at the end of the day
We will be working on the state of the art - get ready to push the limits and have fun!


Requirements

To do an internship with us you need to:


Be doing a curricular internship BsC, MsC..
Be studying in Portugal
Be in love with tech (it is quite visible when interviewing if you really want to grow and internship with us!)
Beware: At this point we're not doing Summer Internships. These are not meant for that


What internships do we have for 2025/2026?

These are plan for candidates that are doing internships of 6 months to 1 year.

Mobile Related:


1. Alfie: A Flutter eCommerce bootstrapper
2. Portuguese Rugby Federation - Kotlin Multiplatform + Compose Multiplatform App


AI Related:


3. Smart Helpdesk Agent: An LLM-powered Assistant for Internal Support Channels
4. SaaS Access Request Automation with AI-Enhanced Governance
5. AI-Powered Robotic Dog for In-Store Product Assistance


What's the process?


Apply via University or this form
Call you for a technical interview (with the intended intership mentor)
Have a Cultural Interview
Get an offer!


Benefits

The Things We Really Care About:


In office, Hybrid or remote - it's your call
Flexible working hours
Laptop & Peripherals that best suit your needs
Mindera Annual Trip, Sports, and sharing groups to connect and have fun!


Other Good Things:


Food and Travel monthly expenses (around 400‚Ç¨)
We have amazing offices in Porto, Aveiro, and Coimbra if you want to physically connect with minders.
At the offices, we have a wide range of snacks to keep you fed and healthy
Partnerships with local businesses


Most of all you get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together in a politics-free environment. Our culture reflects our lean and self-organization attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication. Freedom and Responsibility go hand in hand, and we value commitment, feedback, and empathy.

About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their products and deliver high-performance, resilient, and scalable software systems that create an impact on their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self-management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog and How We Work!

We have offices around the world: Australia, Brazil, India, Morocco, Portugal, Romania, Spain, United Kingdom, United States

Title: Senior/Lead Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

Join a highly innovative and agile team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers based in Hamburg, Porto, and Wroc≈Çaw to shape the next generation of data-driven logistics. As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist in the corporate AI team, you will design and implement world-class AI solutions for automation, decision-making, and optimization using the latest technologies. We are looking for a candidate who combines deep expertise in AI and software development with a passion for solving domain-specific challenges.

How you create impact


Design and implement our AI solutions using state-of-the-art AI technologies.
Shape the entire lifecycle of AI applications ‚Äì from ideation and exploration to specification, architectural design, prototyping, production implementation and enterprise-wide integration.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify new opportunities.
Mentor more junior team members by sharing technical and domain expertise.
Uphold high engineering standards through code reviews and technical guidance.
Take an active role in project coordination and roadmap planning.


What we would like you to bring


Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, physics or a related field.
Two years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist or in an equivalent role.
Capability to envision and deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions.
Advanced hands-on experience in AI model development with strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs), retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and agent-based systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with proven software architecture and development skills in enterprise environments.
Experience with data pipelines, workflow orchestration, APIs and databases. Practical experience with deployment, CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms is a plus.
Experience mentoring team members and consulting with business stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English paired with a collaborative mindset.


What's in it for you

Join Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs IT Hub in Porto or Wroc≈Çaw and make a real impact on the digital transformation of our logistics enterprise. Here, you will find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You‚Äôll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we encourage you to apply ‚Äî your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Software Engineer I
Description:
At Talkdesk, we are courageous innovators focused on redefining the customer experience, making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And, we give back to our community by volunteering our time, supporting non-profits, and minimizing our global footprint. Each day, thousands of employees, customers, and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.




We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations, including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding, a valuation of more than $10 Billion, and a ranking of #16 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.




At Talkdesk, we embrace FAST, our fundamental operating principles that define who we are as an organization. These principles drive us to make the impossible possible. FAST: Focus + Accountability + Speed = Talkdesker.





Focus: Focus time, energy and attention on what is most impactful for the business and thoughtful about how and when to partner with others.


Accountability: Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and drive results. Accept responsibility for successes and failures.


Speed: Execute with agility and urgency. Act promptly, decisively, and without delay. Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.


Talkdesker: YOU!



The Software Engineer I is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software systems. The role requires an understanding of programming languages, software development frameworks, and database management. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of software developers, product managers, and quality assurance specialists to develop high-quality software solutions that meet client requirements.




Duties and Responsibilities:





Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software requirements and design software solutions


Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code


Test and debug software applications


Troubleshoot software issues and provide timely resolutions


Maintain and update existing software systems


Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback


Provide technical support to end-users when required





Qualifications:





Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field


Proven experience in software development


Proficiency in programming languages such as Javascript, TypeScript and React


Knowledge in Java is a plus


Familiarity with software testing methodologies such as unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing


Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills


Ability to work in a team environment


Strong communication skills





¬†




Additional Notes:
This position will follow a hybrid work model.




Work Environment and Physical Requirements:




Primarily office-environment work, extended periods of sitting or standing, computer-based work. Limited lifting, and equipment usage limited to computer-related equipment (keyboards, mouse, etc.)


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Python Rockstar Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team




Join Critical TechWorks as a Python Developer and be part of our dynamic team driving the digital transformation in the automotive landscape for BMW Group's future driving machines. In this role, you'll be more than just a coder; you'll be a problem-solver, planner, and doer, bringing energy and star-quality to crafting high-quality, reliable software components for a variety of groundbreaking projects.




Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.




This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.




Whatever you‚Äôre working on, here‚Äôs the lowdown on the technical skills you‚Äôre likely to have:

Proven experience developing in Python.
Experience developing scripting for Linux.
Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).




CTW's Daily Toolkit




Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.




Who we are




Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:

Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.




Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.




At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people‚Äôs different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Show more
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team


Join Critical TechWorks as a Python Developer and be part of our dynamic team driving the digital transformation in the automotive landscape for BMW Group's future driving machines. In this role, you'll be more than just a coder; you'll be a problem-solver, planner, and doer, bringing energy and star-quality to crafting high-quality, reliable software components for a variety of groundbreaking projects.


  • Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
  • Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
  • Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
  • Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
  • Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.


This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.


Whatever you‚Äôre working on, here‚Äôs the lowdown on the technical skills you‚Äôre likely to have:

  • Proven experience developing in Python.
  • Experience developing scripting for Linux.
  • Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
  • Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).


CTW's Daily Toolkit


Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

  • Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
  • Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
  • Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.

Title: Java Junior (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Backend Java junior

Seniority: 2-3 years

Type of position: HYBRID 2x/week (at Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
2‚Äì3 years of hands-on experience with Java (Java 8 or higher).
Solid understanding of OOP principles and design patterns.
Experience with frameworks such as Spring, Spring Boot, or Hibernate.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
Knowledge of build tools like Maven or Gradle.
Basic understanding of version control systems like Git.
Fluency in Portuguese and English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Exposure to front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular/React).
Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Unit testing and integration testing experience (e.g., JUnit, Mockito).
Exposure to Docker/Kubernetes is a plus.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
